400-desc.en: The request cannot be fulfilled due to bad syntax

401-desc.en: The request was a legal request, but the server is refusing to respond to it. For use when authentication is possible but has failed or not yet been provided

403-desc.en: The request was a legal request, but the server is refusing to respond to it

404-desc.en: The requested page could not be found but may be available again in the future

405-desc.en: Arequest was made of a page using a request method not supported by that page

406-desc.en: The server can only generate a response that is not accepted by the client

407-desc.en: The client must first authenticate itself with the proxy

408-desc.en: The server timed out waiting for the request

409-desc.en: The request could not be completed because of a conflict in the request

410-desc.en: The requested page is no longer available

411-desc.en: The 'Content-Length' is not defined. The server will not accept the request without it

412-desc.en: The precondition given in the request evaluated to false by the server

413-desc.en: The server will not accept the request, because the request entity is too large

414-desc.en: The server will not accept the request, because the URL is too long. Occurs when you convert a POST request to a GET request with a long query information

415-desc.en: The server will not accept the request, because the media type is not supported

416-desc.en: The client has asked for a portion of the file, but the server cannot supply that portion

417-desc.en: The server cannot meet the requirements of the Expect request-header field

500-desc.en: A generic error message, given when no more specific message is suitable

501-desc.en: The server either does not recognize the request method, or it lacks the ability to fulfill the request

502-desc.en: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server

503-desc.en: The server is currently unavailable (overloaded or down)

504-desc.en: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and did not receive a timely response from the upstream server

505-desc.en: The server does not support the HTTP protocol version used in the request

511-desc.en: The client needs to authenticate to gain network access
